item.title: "The whistleblower, Dawn Wooten, says that Irwin, which is...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

"The whistleblower, Dawn Wooten, says that Irwin, which is run by the private corporation LaSalle Corrections, has underreported Covid-19 cases, knowingly placed staff and detainees at risk of contracting the virus, neglected medical complaints, and refused to test symptomatic detainees, among other dangerous practices. On September 8, Wooten submitted a letter detailing her complaints to the Department of Homeland Security’s Office of Inspector General, with the help of atto...rneys from the Government Accountability Project. The grim situation inside the facility reflects what she called “a silent pandemic” running rampant behind the prison bars.
“You don’t want to see what you’re seeing,” Wooten told The Intercept. “You’re responsible for the lives of others,” but Irwin management, in her eyes, downplayed the threat of the virus from the start.
When the first suspected case of Covid-19 arrived at Irwin in March, Wooten says, she overheard the warden, David Paulk, tell a member of the nursing staff not to tell anybody that the man recently transferred might have the coronavirus. “He didn’t want there to be mass panic,” she said. (Reached by phone, Paulk said he had no comment.) Another member of the medical staff ordered Wooten to triage the man, even though she didn’t have a mask. She refused. “They’re still not taking this seriously,” Wooten said. “Enough was enough [...]

Wooten’s account of systematic undercounting of the true spread of the virus accords with what has been reported at other facilities, where ICE has resisted testing because it didn’t have space to quarantine people or ignored glaring symptoms. Detainees at Irwin, echoing those held at other detention centers, also said they were afraid to report their symptoms because they would be locked in solitary confinement, with little medical attention. “It is complete torture, because it’s like a punishment,” one immigrant said, who declined to give their name for fear of reprisals. “I didn’t want to say I had a pain in my throat, or that I had symptoms, because I didn’t want to go back to the punishment cell.”

See MoreIrwin Detention Center, run by LaSalle Corrections, has refused to test detainees and underreported Covid-19 cases, the nurse says.

theintercept.com

“A Silent Pandemic”: Nurse at ICE Facility Blows the Whistle on Coronavirus Dangers

Irwin Detention Center, run by LaSalle Corrections, has refused to test detainees and underreported Covid-19 cases, the nurse says.Irwin Detention Center, run by LaSalle Corrections, has refused to test detainees and underreported Covid-19 cases, the nurse says.

item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

🙏🏽🙏🏿🙏🏾

Community E

There is a lot to discuss about the protest today, but we just wanted to say THANK YOU TO EVERYONE WHO SUPPORTED US!!!

There were no arrests during our protest ...at Francoise Bergan's house. There was no violence. Even when a bunch of fascists showed up trying to instigate things, we made sure that everyone was safe once we headed home. We were in this together, and we came together as people of all backgrounds to stand up for black, brown, and indigenous people!
This is only the beginning!

item.title: Date: Sunday, September 20th, 2020 from 1-3PM. *Please adhere to...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

Date: Sunday, September 20th, 2020 from 1-3PM.

*Please adhere to 6ft social distancing - Wear your masks, bring your hand sanitizer.*

We'll be highlighting the refugee and immigrant experience of our AAPI communities. We want to peacefully express our concerns about the new ICE Director appointment. Please join us in solidarity!

...

Asian refugee and immigrant speakers from Chinese, Vietnamese, And Korean backgrounds will provide their powerful stories and perspectives. Immigration advocates and activists will also provide updates on current issues surrounding immigration.

We invite you to sign postcards to express your support for ICE detainees that will be delivered to local legislators.

Please share this event and encourage others to show up and support!

See More

SUN, SEP 20 AT 1:00 PM MDT

From Vietnamese Refugee to ICE Director? The New Frontline of Asian Racism

3130 Oakland St, Aurora, CO 80010-1502, United States101 people interested

Abolish ICE Denver

Place orders until Sept 18 and for pickup on Sept 19 in Denver & Boulder! You can also purchase masks at both locations!

Sanctuary4All Colorado is in Denver, Colorado.

From Yessenia: The Blanco Martínez family is one of the families that’s been with Sanctuary4All for two years. It’s a family under a deportation order and right... now we need your help. The legal costs coming out way are high and we’ll continue to need your support. Thank you for caring. item.title: Abolish ICE DenverDenver CommunistsAfter the Justice for Antonio Blackbear march, a dozen riot cops marched from the south toward the last...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE DenverDenver Communists

After the Justice for Antonio Blackbear march, a dozen riot cops marched from the south toward the last few dozen protestors assembled at the Capitol steps. The...y were coming after two specific protestors they had clearly targeted for arrest. Motorcycle cops boxed us in from the north and this was the result.

We’ll be working with Colorado Freedom Fund to get them out of jail, but they’ll be held until Monday at least and have been charged with felony resisting arrest and criminal menacing.

See More
item.author: Abolish ICE Denver

item.title: Abolish ICE Denver+12Denver CommunistsJustice for Antonio Blackbear! Last night, in a last-minute mobilization, 125 gathered with Antonio...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver+12Denver Communists

Justice for Antonio Blackbear! Last night, in a last-minute mobilization, 125 gathered with Antonio Blackbear’s mother, wife, daughter, aunt, and other relative...s to protest his murder by Denver Police two days ago.

We began with an Indigenous prayer and remarks from family members, including Lynn Eagle Feather, Antonio’s hunka (adopted) aunt, whose son, Paul Castaway, was also murdered by Denver Police five years ago.

With friendly cars following us, we marched a mile from the Capitol Building past the downtown police headquarters and chanted “Cops! Pigs! Murderers!” at the cops guarding the fence they erected around it. We asked them, “Which one of you killed Antonio Blackbear?” and later, when we confronted some sheriff’s deputies, “Which one of you killed Michael Marshall?”

At the site of Antonio’s murder, family members gathered around a candle-filled memorial and told the crowd about their lost relative. Antonio’s mother expressed how touched she was by the presence of so many who were outraged by the shooting. It was painful to witness yet another family reeling from the shock of the police taking the life of their beloved relative.

The march returned to the Capitol and happened to pass a Starbucks along the way, the windows of which proved to be an irresistible temptation. After most of us had dispersed and gone home, two truckloads of riot cops advanced on those that remained. They were clearly coming for a couple of protestors and we were unable to prevent them from doing so. Two were arrested and won’t be able to be bailed out until Monday. Donations for bail can be made to Colorado Freedom Fund: https://fundly.com/coloradofreedom

Thank you to Antonio’s family, Native Lives Matter, Anon Resistance Movement, and all who showed up against racist police violence!

“When Indigenous lives are under attack, what do we do? Stand up, fight back!”

See More

item.title: The incident marks the 45th time in 2020 that Colorado law...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

The incident marks the 45th time in 2020 that Colorado law enforcement has injured or killed someone in the state, and the eighth time in Denver. Thirty-two people have been killed and another 14 injured.

Police shot and killed a man Saturday morning in Denver’s West Colfax neighborhood after the individual allegedly refused orders to drop his weapon after a lengthy car chase.

denverpost.com

Denver police shoot, kill armed suspect who allegedly refused to drop his weapon after car chase

item.title: Community Alert: Baumgartner Law, LLC has been soliciting...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

Community Alert:

Baumgartner Law, LLC has been soliciting clients from the protests over the summer promising to represent and fight for our community, and is instead dropping cases, not fulfilling promises made, and turning folks away.

We do not tolerate predatory, ambulance-chaser legal practices in our community and warn everyone to not allow him to represent you. Denver has an amazing movement based legal collective, reach out to the National Lawyers Guild of Colorado if you need help!

item.title: Denver Police have killed again! And they won’t stop until we stop them! On Wednesday, Sept 9, they shot and killed...
item.content:encoded:
Denver Police have killed again! And they won’t stop until we stop them! On Wednesday, Sept 9, they shot and killed Antonio Blackbear, a 41-year-old Lakota man.

Antonio was the adopted cousin of another Lakota man killed by the Denver Police five years ago, Paul Castaway. Indigenous people are more likely than any other racial group to be killed by police.

There has been no semblance of justice for Paul in that time, since Denver District Attorneys, like their counterparts around the nation, refuse to hold police accountable for the violent, racist terror that forms the very core of their job description. We expect the fight for justice for Antonio to be a similarly difficult one.

The police have yet to release video of their killing of Antonio, nor say much about it, because they are working to craft a story that casts them in the best light.

Justice for Antonio Blackbear!
Defund, disarm, and disband the police!
item.author: Abolish ICE Denver

We’ve received confirmed reports of one house raid in Fountain, one house raid in Denver and a workplace raid in Denver.

If police come to your home, remember that you do not need to answer any questions. Ask to speak to an attorney.

Call the @coloradonlg legal line to request an attorney or get information: 720-822-5893

item.title: #FREESZASZA URGENT ACTION STEPS ...
item.content:encoded:
#FREESZASZA URGENT ACTION STEPS

Join us in calling and emailing, Ice Deputy Assistant Director, Jeffrey Lynch,
720- 873-2899

Jeffrey.d.lynch@ice.dhs.gov/Jeff.d.lynch@ice.dhs.gov

Collective Call-In Action 9/10 @ 10am- 12pm MT/ 9am- 11am PST/ 11am- 1pm EST
Script Provided

As you may know, Sza Sza Codner or Jennifer Codner is a Jamaican trans woman detained at Aurora Contract Detention Facility.

Sza Sza endured violence and persecution in her country of origin which drove her to seek asylum and refuge here. Since then she's been ferried from one immigrant prison to the other, subjected to solitary confinement, targeting and harassment from guards, placed in men's facilities, and a host of other horrible atrocities.
Help end her indefinite imprisonment by pushing for her release.

Sza Sza has court this Friday, 9/11 and we are determined to assist in getting her out of detention and towards safety.

item.title: Last July, President Trump and administration officials announced to the public that Immigration and Customs Enforcement...
item.content:encoded:
Last July, President Trump and administration officials announced to the public that Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) was planning an operation to target thousands of immigrant families that have received final deportation orders- a carefully coordinated push that was to target on up to 10 "sanctuary" cities across the country.

Many of us in the Coalition to Close the Concentation Camps knew that it was time to take action against forces of fascism and evil- especially for our families impacted by this broken immigration system. On July 12, 2019, radicals and impacted families split from the milquetoast Lights for Liberty vigil being conducted at the Aurora ICE Processing Center. Rebels marched into the parking lot of GEO- where anticolonial speeches were given by indigenous youth and where the now infamous flag removal occurred.

Following the flag removal and international embarrassment, the Aurora Police Department began a Twitter manhunt offering a $4k reward to identify suspects from that evening; violent crimes typically only get a $1k reward and we knew this outrageously large reward was made because two anti police flags were flown that night. Cowards at APD wouldn't fire or prosecute the murderers of Elijah McClain the following month, yet APD had the time and resources to target non-violent protestors demanding justice for immigrants.

The woman featured in this powerful photo, Michelle, was eventually identified by non profit "allies" and served misdemeanor tampering charges; Michelle's case with Aurora dragged on for over a year. Today we have some good news: our hero was found NOT GUILTY by jury trial and walks free of all charges! Fuck APD!

Michelle- you are an inspiration and a true Chingona. With you, our city sent a message to the Department of Homeland Security. Your bravery, in addition to the life Willem Van Spronsen gave on July 13th 2019 by setting ICE's kidnapping vans in Tacoma ablaze, made ICE retreat on their planned nationwide mass arrests of immigrants.

#ChingaLaMigra #AbolishICE
Photo by @buffalo_heart_images
item.author: Abolish ICE Denver

item.title: "All we are asking is to be transferred back to the Aurora facility. We are not asking for a release. They have the...
item.content:encoded:
"All we are asking is to be transferred back to the Aurora facility. We are not asking for a release. They have the authority to transfer us immediately if we want," says Jimmy Sodhi, a 45-year-old ICE detainee.

Sodhi is part of a group of eight ICE detainees who have been housed in the same dormitory at the Teller County Jail since being transferred there from the Aurora Contract Detention Facility one month ago. Sodhi and the other ICE detainees began the hunger strike on the morning of August 10 to protest what they allege are significantly worse conditions at Aurora GEO.

"As a Sikh, I'm not allowed to wear my Sikh bracelet, I'm not allowed to cover my head. If I have to pray, it's required for me to cover my head. I'm told to cover my head with a pillowcase or a towel," says Sodhi, who has been in ICE custody since March 2017 and is currently in the appeals process of his deportation case stemming from a fraud conviction for insider trading. "That is very demeaning, very disrespectful."

Sodhi notes that he was allowed to wear his turban at the Aurora detention facility, but has been told by staff at the Teller County Jail that he cannot retrieve his turban from his personal belongings. Same with prayer books, Sodhi adds, which he hasn't been able to obtain, being told by staff that "there's no chaplain here and we don't have those here."

Additionally, Sodhi contends that he and other ICE detainees at the Teller County Jail have been subjected to racial harassment perpetrated by non-ICE detainees staying in the same dormitory.

[...]

Adding to his angst, Sodhi contends that he and the other detainees don't even know why they're being housed in the Teller County Jail, which has an agreement with ICE to house immigrant detainees.

Via @denverwestword @conormichael28
item.author: Abolish ICE Denver
